name: sfchronicle
text: Alameda County to allow outdoor dining, indoor and outdoor retail, outdoor fitness classes and religious and cultural services (up to 100 people) to resume Friday, with safety measures in place, under an amended health order. https://t.co/8BIfTiyIgw

name: sfchronicle
text:
Outdoor dining, retail stores, malls and limited religious and cultural services will be allowed to reopen in Alameda County starting on Friday, county officials announce.

@MatthewKawahara has the details here: https://t.co/QKBbkv4NM5

name: sfchronicle
text: World premieres by choreographers Cathy Marston, Mark Morris, Danielle Rowe and Myles Thatcher — as well as a return engagement of “A Midsummer Night’s Dream” — are among the highlights of the @sfballet’s 2021 season. https://t.co/fwza1IHqZv

name: sfchronicle
text:
Vallejo police Chief Shawny Williams banned the use of the carotid restraint hold “until further notice,” police officials announced Thursday. 

Protest updates: https://t.co/5Pd6eRmAHC https://t.co/jMPVvAa0rN

name: sfchronicle
text:
Another inmate has died due to the coronavirus at the California Institution for Men in Chino (San Bernardino County), according to the CDCR.

The prison has recorded 16 deaths among inmates, accounting for most of the 18 total inmate deaths in the state. https://t.co/wP5Ti0bgxh

name: sfchronicle
text:
A lot of things are unsettled in the world of sports, but one thing is stable and will be for the foreseeable future: The 49ers head coach. 

@AnnKillion on how the Niners learned from past mistakes by extending Kyle Shanahan's contract: https://t.co/2ffBBIkPQV

name: sfchronicle
text: JetBlue is adding 30 domestic routes between July and October, including several serving San Francisco. https://t.co/ov2g6WBn8G https://t.co/dQAGtBKz5d

name: sfchronicle
text: LIVE UPDATES: According to the Los Angeles Times, a dozen unions representing thousands of Disneyland workers wrote a letter to Gov. Gavin Newsom expressing safety concerns over the park’s scheduled July 17 reopening. https://t.co/n2XFfC1y2g

name: sfchronicle
text:
UPDATE: @49ers receiver Deebo Samuel posts, “Surgery went perfect.” 

Samuel, who blossomed into the team’s most consistent offensive weapon at the end of his rookie season, suffered a broken bone in his foot earlier this week.

https://t.co/ZPgwwD86ji

name: sfchronicle
text: At a first-of-its-kind virtual “Student Support Panel” led by state educators to confront racism and implicit bias in schools, high school students voiced their concerns and called for concrete changes. https://t.co/ID0ldZftLH

name: sfchronicle
text: LIVE UPDATES: In Napa County, a slew of new businesses (including fitness centers, movie theaters, nail salons, massage therapy and tattoo parlors) are allowed to reopen Friday, officials said. This step aligns with the state’s reopening plans. https://t.co/nKUlzIxTXS

name: sfchronicle
text:
“We need our young leaders now,” said Mayor Breed to SFSU's Class of 2020 during their virtual graduation ceremony.

“We need you to help the change the course of this country." https://t.co/plI4QJKlsv

name: sfchronicle
text: LIVE UPDATES: Under a Sonoma County health order, nail salons, bars, movie theaters, gyms, hotels, zoos, libraries, campgrounds and more can reopen Friday. The order is in line with the state’s reopening roadmap. https://t.co/PYHlg66JVV

name: sfchronicle
text:
UPDATE: In an updated statement Thursday evening, Rohnert Park public safety officials said a rope tied into a noose that was found on Thursday hanging in a tree was “placed there for kids to use as a swing.” 

LIVE UPDATES >> https://t.co/dj7xSWsXhm

name: sfchronicle
text: The @Warriors will observe Juneteenth on Friday by encouraging staffers to participate in activities that promote racial justice, the team announced Thursday. @Con_Chron story. https://t.co/bDB7anXy2H

name: sfchronicle
text:
Mary Elizabeth Taylor, assistant secretary of state for legislative affairs, resigned in a letter stating President Trump’s handling of recent events “cut sharply against my core values and convictions,” according to the Washington Post. 

LIVE UPDATES >> https://t.co/Cwy2UyENFy

text:

name: sfchronicle
text: PODCAST: UC Davis student Valeria Blanco was "in tears" when she heard the Supreme Court's ruling on DACA. Immigration reporter @TatianaYSanchez discusses the huge — yet still uncertain — victory for young, undocumented immigrants. https://t.co/oc9i8Lb6ZC

name: sfchronicle
text:
A federal judge issued a temporary order prohibiting the Oakland PD and City of Oakland from using tear gas or firing rubber bullets or flash-bang grenades at people taking part in protests or demonstrations, with some exceptions.

Live updates >> https://t.co/Ofj37TTvxh

name: sfchronicle
text: The unprecedented bill that would mail a ballot to every registered California voter this fall now awaits the signature of Gov. Gavin Newsom. https://t.co/0CcKIaLPOE

name: sfchronicle
text:
Latinos account for half of San Francisco’s coronavirus infections despite representing only 15% of the city’s population.

UCSF released the final results of mass testing nearly 4,000 people in a Mission District.

https://t.co/AYcpZD3ZOw

text:

https://t.co/w2OP784spp
